document_metadata.description: Asymptomatic carrier state, acute respiratory disease, and pneumonia due to severe acute respiratory syndromecoronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2): Facts and myths
document_metadata.licenses: Private Ownership to Fraunhofer Institute SCAI
document_metadata.name: PMID_32173241

citation.db_name: Journal of microbiology, immunology, and infection = Wei mian yu gan ran za zhi

links.evidence: COVID-19 was defined as the respiratory disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 that emerged in China in 2019 (https://www.who.int/westernpacific/emergencies/covid-19).

citation.db_name: Journal of microbiology, immunology, and infection = Wei mian yu gan ran za zhi

links.evidence: The clinical manifestations of COVID-19 are protean, which include asymptomatic carrier, ARD, and pneumonia of varying degrees of severity. First, asymptomatic cases were diagnosed based on positive viral nucleic acid test results, but without any COVID-19 symptoms, such as fever, gastrointestinal, or respiratory symptoms, and no significant abnormalities on chest radiograph [7,8].

citation.db_name: Journal of microbiology, immunology, and infection = Wei mian yu gan ran za zhi

citation.db_name: Journal of microbiology, immunology, and infection = Wei mian yu gan ran za zhi

links.evidence: Among a pooled analysis of 468 patients with pneumonia (Table 2) based on five studies with detailed description of clinical features of the disease, [11, 12, 13, 14,23] male sex comprised 60.3% of patients and the mean age was 53 years.

citation.db_name: Journal of microbiology, immunology, and infection = Wei mian yu gan ran za zhi

links.evidence: However, corticosteroid therapy could be associated with delayed MERS-CoV RNA clearance (adjusted hazard ratio, 0.35; 95% CI, 0.17â0.72; p = 0.005) for critically ill patients with MERS,[40] and early corticosteroid treatment could be associated with higher subsequent plasma RNA load of SARS-CoV for adults with SARS.[41] Moreover, corticosteroid-associated psychosis and diabetes were observed in the treatment of SARS.[42,43].
